creator: mhilpert@gmx.de
text:
When loading a testplan and opening another test plan afterwards, there is only 
one test plan root node (having the name of the second opened test plan) but 
still all the thread groups of the first test plan.

expected would be: to have another root node with the second test plan

or (at least):

having all old thread groups removed and just the second test plan and its 
nodes.

Open currently behaves as a Merge. This is a bit unexpected, so there are plans 
to change this, and also to add a menu command to clear the exisiting tree 
before loading in a new one.

AFAIK, the test plan tree can only have one root, so in my view the behaviour 
you describe is OK - apart from the name of the command ...
creator: sebb@apache.org
mhilpert@gmx.de
text:
but there is no "close" command! i don't want to merge testplans but open 
multiple test plans (at least one after another). so the only way today is, to 
exit the JMeter application, reopen it again, load the new test plan. please 
offer a "close" menu item to be able to open another one 'cleanly'.

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
The "New" command clears out the old test plan.

Would that not do?

Perhaps New should be renamed as Close.

creator: mhilpert@gmx.de
text:
yeah, you're right. hm, this is a quite unfortunate naming of the menu items.

- "New" means "close and create new"
- "Open" means "open and merge with existing"

BTW: selecting "New" does not check for changes of the old test plan! so all 
unsaved changes of the old test plan are lost!!!

I would rather like to have explicit "Close" and "Merge" Items, like:

New    : close current testplan (with user request to save changes of old 
testplan)
Open   : open new test plan (with user request to save changes of old test plan)
Close  : close current test plan (with user request ...)
Merge : behaviour of current "Open"


I would also like to have multiple test plans open in the tree (as several root 
nodes). the Start/Stop menu items would than have submenus with the names of 
the test plans.

The New bug has been fixed in CVS - see bug 23611.

Not sure I agree about multiple test plans; might be awkward to implement. 
Perhaps consider for the future.

I agree about the names being confusing, but it seems to me that your New and 
Close are the same?

How about:
Close = current New behaviour (prompt to save)
Merge = current Open behaviour
and then
Opem = Close as above, then read new plan

Would that suit?

New could then be resurrected later if multiple test plans were supported.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text: yup, your suggestions sound much more intuitive :-)
